I have packages.config file in project and a lot of packages in it, but they does not apprear under installed packages tab. Get-Package cmd outputs "No packages installed."

But I'm able successfully install and upgrade packages if I open the solution in VS2015.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug Bash] The package installation with ‘packages.config’ format is blocked after adding a non-existed feed to package source list for non-SDK project " (#13565) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.11.0.108

### Worked before?

It can be repro on D16.11\34601.136 and D17.10\34902.84.

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:    

1. Create a C# Console App (.NET Framework) project. 

2. Open Tools->Options->NuGet Package Manager->Package Sources and add a non-existed feed (for example: https://packagesource). 

3. Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select "Manage NuGet Packages…" menu item to open PM UI. 

4. Click the settings button (gear) on the top-right of PM UI and check the checkbox: “All format selection on first package install”. 

5. Click “Browse” tab and select the “nuget.org” from Package source drop-down list. 

6. Search "Newtonsoft.Json" package in the filter of “Browse” tab, select the package in the package list and click the ‘Install’ button. 

7. Select “packages.config” radio-box and click “OK” button in the prompt “Choose NuGet Package Manager Format” dialog. 

#### Expected:    

The package will be installed successfully. 

#### Actual: 

The package installs fails with the follow error: 
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/84695155/06798409-d2d1-469d-b22b-1477d735d8ed)
#### Notes:     

1. The repro rate is 100%. 

2. It doesn’t repro on SDK project and non-SDK project that install package with “PackageReference” format. 

3. This error shouldn't block the installation of the package because the selected package source is ‘nuget.org’. 

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug Bash] The package installation with ‘packages.config’ format is blocked after adding a non-existed local feed to package source list for non-SDK project " (#13565) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.11.0.108

### Worked before?

It can be repro on D16.11\34601.136 and D17.10\34902.84.

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:    

1. Create a C# Console App (.NET Framework) project. 

2. Open Tools->Options->NuGet Package Manager->Package Sources and add a non-existed local feed. 

3. Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select "Manage NuGet Packages…" menu item to open PM UI. 

4. Click the settings button (gear) on the top-right of PM UI and check the checkbox: “All format selection on first package install”. 

5. Click “Browse” tab and select the “nuget.org” from Package source drop-down list. 

6. Search "Newtonsoft.Json" package in the filter of “Browse” tab, select the package in the package list and click the ‘Install’ button. 

7. Select “packages.config” radio-box and click “OK” button in the prompt “Choose NuGet Package Manager Format” dialog. 

#### Expected:    

The package will be installed successfully. 

#### Actual: 

The package installs fails with the follow error: 
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/84695155/06798409-d2d1-469d-b22b-1477d735d8ed)
#### Notes:     

1. The repro rate is 100%. 

2. It doesn’t repro on SDK project and non-SDK project that install package with “PackageReference” format. 

3. This error shouldn't block the installation of the package because the selected package source is ‘nuget.org’. 

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as April 8th, 2024" (#72) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as April 8th, 2024. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by April 8th, 2024 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org that are signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-april-8th-2024/
